frame.name: Communication_means
frame.definition: <def-root>This frame concerns <fen>Communicator</fen>s communicating with each other with the aid of a <fen>Means</fen> of communication such as a telephone. </def-root>

FE.name: Communicator
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE is the person who uses the <fen>Means</fen> of communication to deliver the <fen>Message</fen> to the Addressee. The Speaker is normally expressed as the External Argument of target verbs, or as the Genitive modifier of nouns. <ex><fex name="Com">The President</fex> <t>cabled</t> his assistant to cancel all of his appointments.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Addressee
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Addressee</fen> is the person to whom the <fen>Message</fen> is communicated. When this FE is expressed, it often appears in a prepositional phrase introduced by to, or as the direct object, or as the first object in a double object construction. <ex>The President <t>cabled</t> <fex name="Addressee">his assistant</fex> to cancel all other engagements.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Message
FE.definition: <def-root>This is the FE that identifies the content of what the Speaker is communicating to the Addressee. It can be expressed as a clause or as a noun phrase. </def-root>

FE.name: Topic
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Topic</fen> is the subject matter to which the <fen>Message</fen> pertains. It is typically expressed as a PP Complement headed by about.</def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root>This Frame Element is for expressions that elaborate the manner in which an action is carried out. <ex>Jo <t>faxed</t> the document <fex name="Manner">speedily</fex>. </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition: <def-root>This Frame Element refers to the Instrument of Communication that is used by the Speaker (and Addressee).</def-root>

FE.name: Reason
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Reason</fen> for using the means of communication. <ex>Pat <t>phoned</t> <fex name="Reason">to talk about the party</fex>.</ex> Note that this FE does not inheret from Intentional_act.</def-root>

FE.name: Depictive
FE.definition: <def-root>The state of the <fen>Communicator</fen> or <fen>Message</fen>during the communication. <ex><fex name="Dep">Worried about mail delays</fex>, Stephen <t>faxed</t> the agreement.</ex> <ex>Since the general had died in the midst of writing them, the operator <t>telegraphed</t> Andrea's orders <fex name="Dep">incomplete</fex>.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: wire.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: send a telegram or cablegram to.

lexUnit.name: semaphore.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: send by semaphore or by signals resembling semaphore.

lexUnit.name: telegraph.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: send (someone) a message by telegraph

lexUnit.name: radio.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: send a message by radio

lexUnit.name: telephone.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: send a message via the telephone
